title.narrative: 1.5 CP-YOUNG CHILDREN & MOTHERS

description.narrative: 101/005 By 2020, the quality of integrated service delivery and effective coverage have been strengthened in national and subnational child protection systems to support the well-being of children under 5 years and their mothers, in emergency and non- emergency situations, including urban., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. By 2020, women, infants and young children in Bangladesh, especially the most disadvantaged (with disabilities or living in urban, remote and disaster-prone areas), access and utilize high-quality social services in a safe environment, and their families are empowered to practise positive behaviour.

title.narrative: 101/005 By 2020, the quality of integrated service delivery and effective coverage have been strengthened in national andsubnational child protection systems to support the well-being of children under 5 years and their mothers, in emergency and non-emergency situations, including urban.

description.narrative: UNICEF is supporting the Office of Registrar General (ORG) to increase birth registration of children under 5 years. UNICEF provided technical and financial support to the ORG to train 10,000 stakeholders virtually in 2021 to conduct birth registration resulting in 1.2 million children under 5 years being registered. In addition, a total of 60 million people were reached with messages on the importance of birth registration within 45 days of birth all over the country in 2021.;This mass mobilisation initiative will contribute to sensitising parents, caregivers and service providers for timely and accurate birth registration in the country.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
